intro: Erigeron acris subsp. pycnotrichus, commonly known as the thick-hairy blueweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features a basal rosette of narrow, gray-green leaves with dense, stiff hairs. Its flowers are typically blue to purple, arranged in a flat-topped cluster. It is often found in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and meadows.
